The Laudato Si' Challenge, Inspired by Pope Francis

OVERVIEWThe Laudato Si’ Challenge, inspired by Pope Francis, is a global initiative that supports early to mid-stage startups in developing breakthrough enterprise solutions to the world’s most urgent challenges. The challenge, a Right Now! initiative, is set by His Holiness Pope Francis and The Pontifical Council for Justice & Peace, and the competition is open to applicants from all continents and faiths.The Laudato Si’ Challenge will forge a business model to demonstrate that business solutions can realign our relationships to accord with the planet, our only common home. Wherever there is a vulnerable ecosystem, there are vulnerable people; any service to mitigate the crisis involving our common home is also a service to the world’s most disadvantaged people. The inaugural challenge was launched on May 5th, 2017 at The Vatican, and aims to become a multi-year initiative to stimulate and develop innovative businesses through a rigorous and tested process.MISSIONThe Laudato Si’ Challenge, Inspired by Pope Francis will unite humanity in common purpose and productive conversation, much like His Holiness Pope Francis’s “Revolution of Tenderness.” It will be a beacon of new business, inspiring a new generation of entrepreneurs to build for-profit, for-purpose companies that address humanity’s biggest challenges in ways that are beneficial to all.http://laudatosichallenge.org

TRAININGTo ensure the greatest degree of success, TRAINING is used initially to establish a firm foundation and solid base.  Level-setting expectations and gaining buy-in from the organization at ALL levels requires that people understand what they are buying-in to.  Thus, from the executive level down to the individual contributor, everyone attends TRAINING.COACHINGThe next step is COACHING to ensure that the organization can make advances without reinventing the wheel, making costly mistakes which others have already made.  The Agile Coach works with clients to build an agenda based upon their needs.  The Agile Coach engages in activities based upon their core competencies:  Coaching and Facilitating, Teaching and Mentoring, Agile Knowledge and Application, Domain Mastery (Technical, Business, Transformational), and Leadership.  The end goal of COACHING is to help clients develop mastery of their own upon which to draw so that they may coach others.SPEAKING AND FACILITATIONFinally, there is evangelism and advocacy through SPEAKING AND FACILITATION.  As the organization continues to grow and establish its own maturity, there are times when reinforcement and external perspective provide energy to continue on with the cultural shift.  This is where events can play a key role in maintaining that organizational momentum and drive toward continuous improvement.
Providing funding, coaching, and mentoring to small organizations with BIG ideas...

For those who are interested in Agile practices, and live in the greater Wilmington, DE area, the Wilmington Chapter of the Agile Leadership Network is a local community that provides opportunities to connect, discuss, and learn from one another and guest speakers; unlike Agile Philly or the Baltimore Chapter of the ALN, our chapter is focused on the the needs and interests of those local to the greater Wilmington area.

I would recommend Daniel Gullo if you're looking to get certified as a Scrum Master. He was very knowledgable of Agile and has a lot of experience practicing it. He answered all our questions and made the course as fun as possible. When you sign up for a course with Daniel through Scrum Alliance, not only are you getting the course, you are getting support and mentorship with Agile whenever you may need. He also supplies you with references and further readings on Agile after the course is finished. It was definitely worth the time and money to study and connect with Daniel.

CSM, MBA, Sr. IT Business Analyst, Process Modeler
August 10, 2017, Dhiraj was a client of Daniel’s

I received my CSM in July of 2017 under the guidance of Daniel, in Atlanta, Ga. Daniel's certification class was great. Instead of making use of reading materials and slides, he taught Scrum using real world examples and by using other interactive and fun ways. He also provided us with a copy of his book, “Real World Agility” which serves as a good guidance for real world Agile practitioners. At the end of the second day of class, we were divided into groups to perform an activity applying the Scrum principles that we learned during the class. I highly recommend Daniel (Apple Brook Consulting) for you next certification course.

summary: I will help YOU and your organization TOTALLY ROCK...•  I have written THREE books that TOTALLY ROCK:            Real World Agility - Practical Guidance for Agile Practitioners  (ISBN 978-0134191706)          The Definitive Certified ScrumMaster© (CSM) Workbook  (ISBN 978-1545505328)          The Definitive Certified Scrum Product Owner© (CSPO) Workbook  (ISBN 978-1546315346)•  I have a talkshow that TOTALLY ROCK:          AgileNEXT - The NEXT Generation Agile Talk Show          http://agilenext.tv•  I teach classes on how to TOTALLY ROCK:          http://www.apple-brook.com/courselist/•  I have won awards because I TOTALLY ROCK:  2015 Most Valued Agile Professional, 2016 Most Valued Agile Professional, and 2016 Most Popular Scrum Professional•  I have donated tens of thousands of dollars helping Active Duty Military and Veterans TOTALLY ROCK by giving them discounts to our training.  Thank you for your service!!  You all TOTALLY ROCK!!•  We have a team of people at Apple Brook who also TOTALLY ROCK:  Jeff Lopez-Stuit, Jennifer Barker, Nicole Pee, Katie Gullo, Stephen Forte, et al.
